content: Jan Peleska Universität Bremen FB3 TZI BISS AG BS > Deutsch English Jan Peleska Research Interests My current research work focuses on the development of dependable systems, with emphasis on distributed systems and reactive real-time systems. In particular, I investigate formal methods and dependability aspects: safety, reliability, availability and security formal methods for the development of fault-tolerant systems test automation for reactive real-time systems tools development for the application of formal methods CASE methods, formal methods and software development standards I am most interested in the combination and application of existing methods and corresponding tools to "real-world" problems; the development of new methods plays a less important role. Most results of the research activities are motivated by and applied to industrial projects in the field of safety-critical embedded systems and distributed systems, as, for example, avionic systems and railway control systems. A rather complete overview about current research activities and related industrial projects is given in my Habilitation Thesis Formal Methods and the Development of Dependable Systems. I am co-editor of the BISS Monographs - Monographs of the Bremen Institute of Safe Systems, a series of publications related to safety-critical systems, Formal Methods and their applications. I am shareholder of Verified Systems International GmbH .
